org.apache.archiva.repository

Interface Repository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    RepositoryEventHandler
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EditableManagedRepository, EditableRemoteRepository, EditableRepository, ManagedRepository, RemoteRepository
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractManagedRepository, AbstractRemoteRepository, AbstractRepository, BasicManagedRepository, BasicRemoteRepository, MavenManagedRepository, MavenRemoteRepository

    public interface Repository
extends RepositoryEventHandler
    Base interface for repositories. Created by Martin Stockhammer on 21.09.17.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Return the identifier of the repository. Repository identifier should be unique at least for the same type.
        Returns:
        The identifier.

      • getName

        String getName()
        This is the display name of the repository. This string is presented in the user interface.
        Returns:
        The display name of the repository

      • getName

        String getName(Locale locale)
        Returns the name in the given locale.
        Parameters:
        locale -
        Returns:

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Returns a description of this repository.
        Returns:
        The description.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription(Locale locale)
        Returns the description for the given locale.
        Parameters:
        locale -
        Returns:

      • getType

        RepositoryType getType()
        This identifies the type of repository. Archiva does only support certain types of repositories.
        Returns:
        A unique identifier for the repository type.

      • getLocation

        URI getLocation()
        Returns the location of this repository. For local repositories this might be a file URI, for remote repositories a http URL or some very repository specific schemes. Each repository has only one unique location.
        Returns:
        The repository location.

      • getLocalPath

        Path getLocalPath()
        Returns the local path that this repository uses, if it stores data locally. You should keep in mind, that repository implementations may not store any data in this directory. E.g. if the repository data is handled by a database. So the content of this directory is very implementation specific. Users of this directory must know about the repository file layout if they use this path. Repository implementations should always return a valid path, even if there is no locally stored data. Some extensions may use the path to store their own repository specific data, e.g. statistics, metadata,...
        Returns:
        the filesystem path to the repository.

      • getFailoverLocations

        Set<URI> getFailoverLocations()
        A repository may allow additional locations that can be used, if the primary location is not available.
        Returns:

      • isScanned

        boolean isScanned()
        True, if this repository is scanned regularly.

      • getSchedulingDefinition

        String getSchedulingDefinition()
        Returns the definition, when the repository jobs are executed. This must return a valid a cron string.
        Returns:

      • hasIndex

        boolean hasIndex()
        Returns true, if this repository has a index available
        Returns:

      • getLayout

        String getLayout()
        Returns a layout definition. The returned string may be implementation specific and is not standardized.
        Returns:

      • getCapabilities

        RepositoryCapabilities getCapabilities()
        Returns the capabilities of the repository implementation.
        Returns:

      • getFeature

        <T extends RepositoryFeature<T>> RepositoryFeature<T> getFeature(Class<T> clazz)
                                                          throws UnsupportedFeatureException
        Extension method that allows to provide different features that are not supported by all repository types.
        Type Parameters:
        T - This is the class of the feature
        Parameters:
        clazz - The feature class that is requested
        Returns:
        The feature implementation for this repository instance, if it is supported
        Throws:
        UnsupportedFeatureException - if the feature is not supported by this repository type

      • supportsFeature

        <T extends RepositoryFeature<T>> boolean supportsFeature(Class<T> clazz)
        Returns true, if the requested feature is supported by this repository.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The requested feature class
        Parameters:
        clazz - The requested feature class
        Returns:
        True, if the feature is supported, otherwise false.

      • getIndexingContext

        ArchivaIndexingContext getIndexingContext()
        Returns a indexing context.

        Throws:

        Closes all resources that are opened by this repository.
